result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald A. Hill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:03 pm - 16CF6, 16CF7, 16CM9 - Defendant Donald A. Hill appeared with attorney David Deda.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. Court questions DE regarding waiver of preliminary hearing form. Court finds waiver is given freely and accepts. Parties have received and reviewed and waive reading of information filed in 16CF7. DE pleads GUILTY to 16CF7.  Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire and elements of charge. Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 16CF7 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads in 16CF6 & 16CM9. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Submit DNA sample. Appeal rights given. Adj. 2:31 pm. 

Court imposes:
16CF7 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation. Conditions: $400 fine; $250 DNAAS; $40 Buy Money ($20 read in from 16CF6); AODA; NO possession or consumption of a controlled substance except if prescribed by a physician and only in the amounts and frequency prescribed; Contraband evidence may be destroyed after appeal time limits have expired.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

16CM9, 16CF6, 16CF7 - Defendant Donald A. Hill appeared with attorney David Deda.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Defendant pleads NOT GUILTY to 16CM9. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived on felony cases.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue on felony cases.
Search warrant; Application and affidavit; Return of Officer

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

2:14 pm - Plainiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant appears in person, in custody. DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 02-02-16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint. Court sets bond.
Search Warrant; Application and Affidavit; Return of Officer
